purpose: The commit fixes a bug in the Bluetooth hci_sync module by checking if the HCI_UNREGISTER flag has been set before queuing commands, preventing a potential use-after-free error.
The commit removes an unnecessary include statement for asm/termios.h in n_hdlc.c, as it's already included through linux/tty.h. The change aims to simplify the code and reduce complexity.
This commit updates the documentation for the 'perf c2c' tool to reflect changes in the report table, specifically adding a new metric 'N/A' for store operations.

The commit fixes issues related to vma lock handling during split vma and range unmapping in the hugetlb code. It addresses two key issues pointed out by Miaohe Lin, including a race condition in hugetlb_unmap_file_folio and the need for a vma lock in all VM_MAYSHARE vmas. The commit also updates the hugetlb open vm_ops to allocate a new vma lock for the new vma during vma splitting.

This commit adds documentation for two new supplies, AVDD and MICVDD, to the device tree binding for the Realtek rt5682s codec. The changes include adding properties for these supplies in the YAML file and updating the examples section to demonstrate their usage.

The commit fixes a resource leak in the zorro7xx_remove_one() function by adding a missing iounmap() call to release a mapped I/O region. This change ensures that resources are properly cleaned up when removing a device.

The commit removes an unused field 'work' from the struct mlx5e_async_ctx in the mlx5e driver, which is related to kTLS (kernel Transport Layer Security) offloading. The removal of this field does not seem to have any functional impact on the code.

The commit changes the type of a struct member 'key_idx' from unsigned to signed in order to avoid warnings from static checkers when assigning -1 to it. The change is made to accommodate a specific use case where key is NULL.

This commit sorts CONFIG_SURFACE_PLATFORMS in two RISC-V defconfig files, nommu_k210_defconfig and nommu_k210_sdcard_defconfig. The change is cosmetic and does not affect the functionality of the code.

The commit introduces a new function mcp251xfd_is_fd_mode() to check if the chip's FIFOs are configured for CAN-FD mode, replacing open-coded checks in multiple places. This change improves code readability and maintainability.
The commit modifies a self-test for the Real-Time Clock (RTC) to skip tests when the RTC is not present, avoiding unnecessary failures.
The commit removes a redundant assignment to the variable 'bytes' in the snd_echo_midi_output_write function, which is never read. This change cleans up a clang scan build warning about dead code.

This commit decouples the presence of rcuscale from the presence of RCU Tasks, allowing rcuscale to be built without RCU Tasks. The technical changes include modifying Kconfig.debug and rcuscale.c files.

The commit removes a duplicated phrase 'be split' in a comment within the spte.h file, which is part of the x86 KVM MMU code. The change seems to be purely cosmetic and does not affect the functionality of the code.

The commit reverts a previous change that populated the dcn315 clk table based on dcfclk, due to issues with pmfw filling out the table when dcfclk states are disabled. The revert is intended to prevent underflow until a better solution is implemented.

This commit adds documentation for the Renesas RZ/V2L SoC's Bifrost Mali-G31 GPU to the devicetree bindings. The change involves adding a compatible string for the R9A07G054 SoC to the arm,mali-bifrost.yaml file.
The commit renames a struct from pcie_port to dw_pcie_rp in multiple files within the drivers/pci/controller/dwc directory, making it more consistent with other names.

The commit fixes a warning issued by clang regarding a format specifier mismatch in a debug message. The code change updates the format specifier from '%#06hx' to '%#06x' to match the type of the argument being passed, which is an unsigned short that gets promoted to an int.

The commit fixes a warning triggered by a negative offset in the branch range check for MIPS jump labels. The change casts the upper bound of the branch range to long to perform a signed compare, avoiding the warning.

The commit removes a redundant case from the SetHwReg8188EU function, which is part of an ongoing effort to eliminate the unwanted hal layer. The removed case was calling a function directly, so it's replaced with a direct call to that function.
The commit fixes a sparse warning by declaring non-global symbols as static in the arm64 kernel code.
The commit updates device tree bindings for display subsystems on certain Qualcomm SoCs, specifically removing interrupt flags from MDSS nodes as they are not applicable.
The commit allocates space for arrays in struct ctrl_ref, which is a preparation step for allowing drivers to change the array size.

This commit adds new PMICs and SoCs to the socinfo driver, specifically SM8350, SC8280XP, SA8540P, and additional variants of SM8450. The changes are limited to adding new entries to the pmic_models array and the soc_id table.

The commit updates the wifi driver to recognize all possible chip cuts, which are represented by letters from A (0) to P (15). The change replaces a switch statement that only recognized chip cuts up to E with a more general approach that uses the chip_cut value directly.
The commit removes a custom software enable count for PRCMU clocks, as the core already keeps its own software enable count.

The commit aims to reduce the usage of #ifdef CONFIG_XIP_KERNEL in the RISC-V mm/init.c file by reorganizing code and macros. It moves the pt_ops macro to adjacent #ifdef CONFIG_XIP_KERNEL blocks and groups similar usage cases together.
The commit enables QUP and GPI DMA hardware in the device tree for the sm6350-sony-xperia-lena-pdx213 platform, allowing for the addition of functioning I2C nodes later.

This commit fixes comments in the thermal driver for RZG2L, specifically changing a comment to better explain what 'Capture times' means, fixing a typo in 'caliberation', and reformatting code to follow coding style guidelines.
The commit fixes an infinite loop that occurs when releasing SW_FW_SYNC resource due to failure in acquiring HW semaphore, typically caused by surprise removal of hardware.

The commit updates the pcm3168a driver to use modern ASoC DAI format terminology, specifically changing 'master_mode' to 'provider_mode'. This change is part of a larger effort to remove old style defines for bus clocks.
The commit removes a pointless hack related to IS_SWAPFILE, which is always defined. The code change involves deleting unnecessary lines of code in fs/nfs/file.c.

This commit implements GTP echo response for GTP devices created through ip link, which was missing in previous versions. The code adds functionality to handle GTP echo requests and send responses according to the GTP specification.

The commit replaces cpumask_next_* functions with cpumask_first_* where appropriate, introducing a new function cpumask_first_zero(). The changes are made in various files to improve the effectiveness of finding the first CPU in a cpumask.

The commit removes a call to 'dtim_assoc' IOVAR in the brcmfmac driver, which was causing an error message to be displayed on the console after roaming. The change ensures that the host driver will no longer try to get TIM information from firmware.

The commit adds support for a platform without an amplifier, specifically the alc5682 headset codec, by introducing a new board config adl_rt5682. The changes involve modifying two files: sof_rt5682.c and soc-acpi-intel-adl-match.c.

The commit adds a check to fail zerocopy sendmsg requests when the socket does not support it, similar to a previous patch that did the same for zerocopy send requests. The technical change is the addition of two lines of code in io_uring/net.c to test if the socket supports zerocopy and return an error if it doesn't.

The commit improves the kerneldoc-preamble.sty file to conditionally load xeCJK.sty only if it exists, preventing xelatex errors on certain distros. It also updates the note for missing CJK fonts and adds a mention of the texlive-xecjk package.
The commit modifies the checkpatch script to allow 'case' macros without reporting errors, as these are already used in some in-kernel drivers.

The commit converts the simpledrm driver to use atomic helpers, replacing the old simple-KMS helpers. This change allows for easier code sharing among drivers and improves the overall architecture of the driver.

This commit adds a jpeg decoding worker interface to ensure that three HWs run in parallel in MT8195. It introduces new functions for getting, putting, and setting hardware parameters, as well as a worker function for handling the jpeg decoding process.

This commit removes unnecessary VPRINTK() calls in the libata code, which were previously used for debugging purposes but are now redundant due to the presence of tracepoints. The commit also removes the ata_scsi_dump_cdb() function and its associated calls.

This commit adds support for zstate during extended vblank in the AMD display driver. It introduces a new function dc_extended_blank_supported to check if extended blank is supported, and modifies existing functions to use this new functionality.

The commit fixes a type mismatch issue in the hqd_destroy() callback function, which was causing a Control Flow Integrity (CFI) failure when booting a kernel compiled with CONFIG_CFI_CLANG on a machine with an RX 6700 XT. The fix updates the function pointer prototype to match the actual type of the reset_type parameter.

The commit corrects a typo in the 'resets' property name in the device tree binding documentation for STM32 pin control, and adds a missing 'additionalProperties: false' to prevent additional properties from being added. The change is minor but necessary for correctness.

The commit silences an array-bounds warning on GCC 12 by adding a flag to disable this specific warning for the mac.o file in the ath9k driver. The warning is triggered by an array subscript that is above the array bounds, but the commit author does not understand why the compiler reports the value 32.

The commit replaces pm_runtime_get_sync with pm_runtime_resume_and_get in the sun8i-ss-prng.c file, which is a part of the crypto driver for Allwinner SoCs. This change simplifies the code and is likely related to power management.

The commit refactors the io_uring filetable code, splitting out fixed file installation and removal into separate functions. It also updates function signatures to take a ctx instead of an io_kiocb, which is more appropriate for operations on the ring itself.

The commit updates the device tree bindings for the NXP i.MX8MQ VPU to split the G1 and G2 nodes into separate entities, reflecting their independence and separate power-domain control. The changes include updating the compatible properties, reg, interrupts, clocks, and power-domains to support the new node structure.

The commit removes a macro definition IWL_DEVICE_BZ_COMMON and combines its contents into another macro definition IWL_DEVICE_BZ, simplifying the code. The changes are limited to a single file in the iwlwifi driver.
